examples: Badgers are found all over the world.
So what do the badgers do?
Badgers like to eat worms, but they also will eat just about anything else.
And also like badgers, they’ll eat just about anything.
It's a honey badger getting scared by galoshes.
words.defineEn: to repeatedly and annoyingly ask someone something, particularly as a way of persuasion
words.defineVi: liên tục và khó chịu hỏi ai đó một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một cách thuyết phục

words.defineEn: frivolous banter
words.defineVi: nói đùa phù phiếm

examples: Baby whales are born without any callosities, but they start to develop within a few months.
But here’s the thing: whale callosities are naturally gray.
Those white spots are called callosities because, well, they’re basically calluses.
One lives in deep pits in callosities, while the other one hangs out in more open spots.
And we all lack what’s known as ischial callosities.
words.defineEn: devoid of passion or feeling; hardheartedness
words.defineVi: không có đam mê hay cảm xúc; sự cứng lòng

examples: And it would be one thing if their callous indifference and rank hypocrisy were benign, but it's not Your indifference cost these men and women their most valuable commodity - time
But why, why is the universe structured in this terrible and callous way?
So Trump, as a sort of a callous guy who’s very mean publicly to people, that’s one thing.
Your a soft person whose hands have never known a callous and whose mind has been turned to pudding by screens.
You're a nightmare, Mr. Trump You're a callous, sexist, stooge Mocking disabled reporters Calling women ugly, too Donald Truuump!
words.defineEn: emotionally hardened
words.defineVi: tình cảm cứng rắn

words.defineEn: impractical, inconvenient, and inadvisable
words.defineVi: không thực tế, bất tiện, và không nên

examples: At the end of the day, this is an inexorable march toward a transition to a zero-carbon economy.
I mean the stark reality of that decline came in 1757 when the British East India Company established itself permanently in Bengal and began its inexorable efforts to colonize all of India.

You might just think of tides as the ocean going in and out every day, but in fact what astronomers call tides are a subtle but inexorable force that have literally shaped most objects in the Universe.
These are the different possible kinds of corpses of dead stars, and what distinguishes them is how they hold themselves up against the inexorable attraction of gravity.
As with Harold Loeb, Scott and Hemmingway were friends, but through the years it was as if Hemmingway had some inexorable drive to sabotage their friendship.
words.defineEn: not to be placated or appeased or moved by entreaty
words.defineVi: không được xoa dịu hoặc xoa dịu hoặc di chuyển bởi lời cầu xin

examples: And not to exercise that power is inexplicable to me.
But, for sort of inexplicable reasons, President Trump isn't really taking that victory lap.
Like Atticus is too old to play tackle football and, to his daughter’s inexplicable horror, he wears glasses.
Even the things we perceive can sometimes seem inexplicable.
Early discoveries of inexplicable natural phenomenon let our imagination run wild.
words.defineEn: incapable of being explained or accounted for
words.defineVi: không thể được giải thích hoặc giải thích

words.defineEn: not extensile
words.defineVi: không mở rộng

examples: My fitness coach kept telling me I need to eat breakfast like a king, lunch like a prince and dinner like a pauper in order to maintain my muscle mass while cutting body fat.
King or pauper, no one was safe from the plague.
When he died rather suddenly, authorities buried him in an unmarked pauper’s grave.
words.defineEn: a person who is very poor
words.defineVi: một người rất nghèo

words.defineEn: a state of extreme poverty or destitution
words.defineVi: một tình trạng cực kỳ nghèo đói hoặc cơ cực

examples: Reestablish a federal bank!
The government also deployed more troops to the area to reestablish calm amid rising ethnic tensions.
The company plans to reestablish itself in the prestigious global Formula One racing series in 2021.
And we will do so as soon as that connection is reestablished.
And we will do so as soon as that connection is reestablished.
words.defineEn: bring back into original existence, use, function, or position
words.defineVi: đưa trở lại sự tồn tại, sử dụng, chức năng hoặc vị trí ban đầu

examples: The food packaging film had a color retention agent to prevent discoloration and maintain the attractive appearance of it.
The frozen berries included a color retention agent that prevented the vibrant red color from fading during storage.
So we've seen a huge surge not only in the interest in women applicants, but also the retention of women cadets.
This card includes a retention bracket for attaching to some select chassis.
I mean, retention rates are very low in this industry.
words.defineEn: the act of retaining something
words.defineVi: hành động giữ lại một cái gì đó

examples: The laws were reformed root and branch.
These reforms will produce little change.
The reforms served as a model for the rest of the Communist world.
Efforts at reform seem to come in fits and starts.
School reform is a sensitive issue, and many politicians treat it with kid gloves.
words.defineEn: to make a society, law, system, or organization better or more effective by making many changes to it
words.defineVi: để làm cho một xã hội, pháp luật, hệ thống, hoặc tổ chức tốt hơn hoặc hiệu quả hơn bằng cách thực hiện nhiều thay đổi đối với nó

examples: She ran as a reformer.
So the reformers took the first TV channel under their control, and they were happy to do that.
Putin cultivated the image of a reformer and a democrat.
Reformers across the Dutch states and the Habsburg Netherlands want to be more like the new United States, while Poles are demanding that the partition of their country be undone.
He was considered to be a liberal reformer.
words.defineEn: an apparatus that reforms the molecular structure of hydrocarbons to produce richer fuel
words.defineVi: một bộ máy cải cách cấu trúc phân tử của hydrocarbon để tạo ra nhiên liệu phong phú hơn

examples: And thank Yadwigha for his obstinate toil.
You can kind of reach an agreement, even if the person is being really obstinate.
words.defineEn: stubborn and unwilling to change one's behaviors, opinions, views, etc. despite other people's reasoning and persuasion
words.defineVi: bướng bỉnh và không muốn thay đổi hành vi, ý kiến, quan điểm của mình, v.v. mặc cho lý lẽ và sự thuyết phục của người khác

words.defineEn: resolute adherence to your own ideas or desires
words.defineVi: kiên quyết tuân thủ ý tưởng hoặc mong muốn của riêng bạn

examples: Perspiring a little bit.
words.defineEn: excrete perspiration through the pores in the skin
words.defineVi: bài tiết mồ hôi qua lỗ chân lông trên da

examples: He's famous for saying, "One percent inspiration, 99 percent perspiration."

Tiny amounts of perspiration must have gotten into the test chambers in all these experiments.
And Charlie, here, is getting a lotta perspiration turning into some partici-- partici-- (laughs) Precipitation!
words.defineEn: salty fluid secreted by sweat glands
words.defineVi: chất lỏng mặn do tuyến mồ hôi tiết ra

examples: The friends would sometimes revert to playground idiom.
The company's attempt to rebrand itself came full circle when they reverted back to their original name.
In other words, they revert to an earlier developmental state.
However, they reverted their decisions after a public outcry, accusing them of discrimination.
Deprived of artificial light, we revert to these old patterns.
words.defineEn: to go back to a previous state, condition, or behavior
words.defineVi: để quay lại trạng thái, điều kiện hoặc hành vi trước đó

words.defineEn: turning in the opposite direction
words.defineVi: rẽ theo hướng ngược lại
